THFM-STAGE-0.name: Trusted Employee
THFM-STAGE-0.description: Individual with legitimate access operating within normal behavioural parameters. No observable risk indicators. This is the baseline state for all authorised users.

detectionControls.name: Access Agreements
detectionControls.purpose: Signed agreements establish behavioural expectations and legal framework

THFM-STAGE-0.interventionWindow: Preventive — screening and onboarding controls reduce probability of future progression
THFM-STAGE-0.transitionTrigger: Predisposition factors (THFM-IN-03, THFM-IN-05, THFM-IN-06) activated by life events or organisational changes

THFM-STAGE-1.name: At-Risk Individual
THFM-STAGE-1.description: Personal predispositions or early stressors create vulnerability to insider risk. Individual may not yet have any malicious intent — this stage includes negligent and pre-malicious states. CERT CPIR reports 76% of insiders did not join with malicious intent; they entered the pathway here.

indicators.observableSigns: Unexpected lifestyle changes, wage garnishment, bankruptcy filings, gambling indicators
indicators.detectionMethod: HR records, Employee Assistance Programme referrals, continuous vetting

indicators.observableSigns: Passed over for promotion, negative performance review, conflict with management, formal grievance
indicators.detectionMethod: HR records, manager reporting, exit interview patterns

indicators.observableSigns: Divorce, family crisis, substance abuse, significant behavioural changes
indicators.detectionMethod: EAP referrals, peer reporting, manager awareness

indicators.observableSigns: Expressed grievances about company direction, ethical objections, radicalisation indicators
Unusual foreign contacts, unexplained travel, unreported outside employment
indicators.detectionMethod: Vetting updates, continuous evaluation, travel monitoring

detectionControls.name: Insider Threat Programme
detectionControls.purpose: Organisational framework for identifying and responding to insider risk indicators

detectionControls.name: Personnel Screening
detectionControls.purpose: Continuous evaluation and periodic rescreening detect emerging risk factors

detectionControls.name: Awareness Training
detectionControls.purpose: Manager and peer awareness training enables early identification of concerning changes

THFM-STAGE-1.interventionWindow: Early intervention — 71% of insider threats detectable at this stage by mature programmes (CERT research). EAP support, management engagement, and workload review are non-punitive interventions.
THFM-STAGE-1.transitionTrigger: Stressor event + rationalisation (Fraud Triangle completion). Failed or absent organisational intervention. Opportunity discovery.

THFM-STAGE-2.name: Concerning Behaviour
THFM-STAGE-2.description: Observable behavioural changes indicating escalating risk. The individual begins testing boundaries through minor policy violations, unusual access patterns, or data behaviours that deviate from their baseline. This is the critical intervention window — the Fraud Triangle is forming but not yet complete.

indicators.observableSigns: Accessing systems or data outside normal role, unusual working hours, access to sensitive files without business need
Downloading unusual volumes, bulk file access, accessing sensitive directories, personal device data transfer
Minor security policy breaches, tailgating, credential sharing, bypassing security controls
indicators.detectionMethod: Audit logs, physical access monitoring, security policy violation tracking

indicators.observableSigns: Increased isolation, expressions of injustice, hostile communications, disengagement from team
indicators.detectionMethod: Manager reporting, HR engagement, peer reporting channels

indicators.observableSigns: Researching data exfiltration methods, testing removable media policies, exploring network shares
indicators.detectionMethod: Endpoint monitoring (TTCE-EP-01), web proxy logs (TTCE-NP-04), search query logging

detectionControls.name: Audit Review, Analysis, and Reporting
detectionControls.purpose: Systematic review of audit logs identifies anomalous access patterns

detectionControls.name: System Monitoring
detectionControls.purpose: Continuous monitoring detects behavioural anomalies and policy violations

detectionControls.name: Account Management
detectionControls.purpose: Periodic access review identifies privilege accumulation and inappropriate access

detectionControls.name: Insider Threat Programme
detectionControls.purpose: Structured response framework for concerning behaviour indicators

THFM-STAGE-2.interventionWindow: Critical intervention window. Non-punitive engagement preferred — CERT research shows heavy-handed response at this stage escalates 40% of cases. EAP referral, access adjustment, management dialogue.
THFM-STAGE-2.transitionTrigger: Opportunity + escalation. Failed organisational intervention (CERT CPIR Stage 4: Problematic Organisational Response). Pressure intensification.

THFM-STAGE-3.name: Active Insider Threat
THFM-STAGE-3.description: The Fraud Triangle is complete: pressure + opportunity + rationalisation. The individual begins deliberate misuse of legitimate access for unauthorised purposes. Actions include data exfiltration, privilege abuse, cover-up activities, and preparation for departure or escalation.
THFM-STAGE-3.certCpirMapping: Late Stage 3 (Concerning Behaviours escalating to action)

indicators.observableSigns: Large file transfers to external destinations, USB usage spikes, personal email forwarding of corporate data, cloud upload to personal accounts
Privilege escalation attempts, accessing other users' accounts, credential harvesting, creating backdoor accounts
Log clearing or modification, anti-forensics tool usage, unusual deletion patterns, audit trail gaps
indicators.detectionMethod: SIEM integrity monitoring, file integrity monitoring (TTCE-EP-02), audit trail analysis

indicators.observableSigns: Updating CV/LinkedIn during work hours, increased personal calls, resignation signals, knowledge hoarding
indicators.detectionMethod: HR awareness, manager reporting, DLP correlation with HR status

detectionControls.name: Least Privilege
detectionControls.purpose: Limits blast radius by constraining access to minimum required

detectionControls.name: Audit Record Generation
detectionControls.purpose: Comprehensive logging enables forensic reconstruction of insider actions

detectionControls.name: Incident Handling
detectionControls.purpose: Structured response to confirmed insider threat activity

detectionControls.name: Boundary Protection
detectionControls.purpose: Network-level controls constrain data exfiltration paths

THFM-STAGE-3.interventionWindow: Reactive — damage limitation and evidence preservation. Legal and HR coordination required. Access revocation must be balanced with evidence collection needs.
THFM-STAGE-3.transitionTrigger: Execution of data theft, sabotage, fraud, or espionage action with material impact

THFM-STAGE-4.name: Impact
THFM-STAGE-4.description: Active damage has occurred. The insider has executed their objective — data theft, IT sabotage, fraud, or espionage. Detection at this stage is reactive; the goal is minimising blast radius, preserving evidence, and preventing recurrence. CERT statistics: IT sabotage peaks within 30 days of termination, IP theft within 60 days before departure, median dwell time 8 months (IP theft) to 3 years (espionage).

indicators.observableSigns: Data destruction, service disruption, system wipe, logic bomb detonation, ransomware deployment
indicators.detectionMethod: EDR (TTCE-EP-01), SIEM (TTCE-DT-01), backup integrity checks, service monitoring

indicators.observableSigns: Confirmed data exfiltration, trade secret compromise, source code theft, customer data extraction
indicators.detectionMethod: DLP (TTCE-DP-01), forensic analysis, cloud audit logs, legal discovery

indicators.observableSigns: Financial fraud, procurement fraud, expense fraud, payroll manipulation, unauthorised transactions
indicators.detectionMethod: Financial audit, account management (AC-2), audit review (AU-6), anomaly detection

indicators.observableSigns: Long-term data collection, classified/restricted material extraction, intelligence transfer to external handler
indicators.detectionMethod: Counter-intelligence, DLP (TTCE-DP-01), forensic analysis, communications monitoring

detectionControls.name: System Backup
detectionControls.purpose: Enables recovery from sabotage and data destruction

detectionControls.name: Incident Handling
detectionControls.purpose: Structured response including evidence preservation and legal coordination

detectionControls.name: Incident Monitoring
detectionControls.purpose: Tracking impact scope and ongoing insider activity

detectionControls.name: Audit Review, Analysis, and Reporting
detectionControls.purpose: Forensic reconstruction of insider actions for legal proceedings

THFM-STAGE-4.interventionWindow: Post-incident — focus on containment, evidence preservation, legal proceedings, and lessons learned. Access immediately revoked.
